wording.text: {masculine_name} has {nb1} marbles. He gives them out to {nb2} friends. How many marbles will get each friend?
{feminine_name} has {nb1} marbles. She gives them out to {nb2} friends. How many marbles will get each friend?
It took {nb2} days to my golden goose to lay {nb1} eggs. How many eggs did she lay everyday?
The gardener has planted {nb1} salads, splitted in {nb2} rows. How many salads is there in a row?
The gardener has planted {nb1} cabbages, splitted in {nb2} rows. How many cabbages is there in a row?
A market gardener has planted {nb1} salads, splitted in {nb2} rows. How many salads is there in a row?
A market gardener has planted {nb1} cabbages, splitted in {nb2} rows. How many cabbages is there in a row?
I will give out {nb1} candies to the {nb2} friends that I invited at my birthday's party. How many candies will receive each of my friends?
{name} put {nb1} pencils away in {nb2} boxes. How many pencils are there in each box?
{name} paid {nb1} £ for {nb2} pens. How much does cost one pen? |hint:£|
{masculine_name} has received altogether {nb1} £ pocket money in {nb2} months. How much did he receive every month? |hint:£|
{feminine_name} has received altogether {nb1} £ pocket money in {nb2} months. How much did she receive every month? |hint:£|
Our neighbours have {nb1} sheep. That's {nb2} times more than us. How many sheep do we have?
{name} has prepared {nb1} truffles splitted in {nb2} packets. How many truffles is there in one packet?
